events.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
events.summary: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.

events.title: A South Korean court sentences Yoon to 5 years in prison on charges related to martial law decree
events.summary: A South Korean court has sentenced former President Yoon Suk Yeol to five years in prison, the first verdict in eight criminal trials for allegations that include his 2024 martial law decree.

events.title: Venezuela's Machado says she presented her Nobel Peace Prize to Trump during their meeting
events.summary: Venezuelan opposition leader María Corina Machado said she presented her Nobel Peace Prize medal to President Donald Trump at the White House on Thursday even as he has questioned her credibility to take over her country after the U.S. ousted then-President Nicolás Maduro.

events.title: Iran's protests appear increasingly smothered after a deadly crackdown
events.summary: The nationwide protests challenging Iran's theocracy appear increasingly smothered a week after authorities shut the country off from the world and escalated a bloody crackdown.

events.title: European troops arrive in Greenland to boost the Arctic island's security
events.summary: Troops from several European countries, including France, Germany, Norway and Sweden, are arriving in Greenland after talks between Denmark, Greenland and the U.S. on Wednesday highlighted disagreement.

events.title: What Teddy Roosevelt has to do with Trump's moves in Venezuela and Greenland
events.summary: Presidents James Monroe and Theodore Roosevelt helped shape a policy that rationalizes U.S. intervention in Latin America and elsewhere. But Trump has brought that idea to a whole new level.

events.title: Uganda goes to the polls amid heavy security and internet blackout
events.summary: Ugandans are voting in a tense presidential election as 81-year-old President Yoweri Museveni seeks to extend his four-decade rule amid an internet shutdown and heavy military deployment.

events.title: Denmark and U.S. to form working group to talk about U.S. security concerns
events.summary: After meeting with President Trump's top aides, Danish officials say they will form a working group to talk through U.S. security concerns about control of Greenland.

events.title: Venezuelan opposition member Freddy Guevara talks about the future of his country
events.summary: Freddy Guevara, former vice president of the Venezuelan Parliament and a member of the Venezuelan opposition, talks about what's next for his country.

events.title: U.S. says second phase of Gaza ceasefire has begun, but major challenges remain
events.summary: The White House says the ceasefire deal between Israel and Hamas is moving into its second phase, which includes the demilitarization of Gaza, a key point in President Trump's peace plan.

events.title: WEF: Donald Trump set to dominate Davos 2026
events.summary: Davos braces for Trump's return. Weeks after attacking Venezuela, capturing its controversial leader, and reviving Greenland ambitions, the US president's presence is expected to raise the stakes at WEF's annual meeting.

events.title: X outages affect thousands of users primarily in US
events.summary: It's the second time in a week that the network has had connectivity issues for users.

events.title: 2026 stargazing: Eclipses, meteor showers and supermoons
events.summary: 2026 will leave stargazers spoiled for sights in the sky, with four eclipse events, multiple meteor showers and several supermoons.

events.title: German firms hunker down as Trump marks one year in office
events.summary: One year into Donald Trump's second term, higher tariffs and sharper threats are straining transatlantic business. German companies in the US are weighing compliance against resistance as uncertainty grows.

events.title: Iran protest crackdown: What are the US's military options?
events.summary: Since the start of the latest wave of protests in Iran, Donald Trump has been back and forth on US intervention. With the situation changing constantly, what do experts think are the options for the US in Iran?

events.title: Munich Security Conference withdraws Iran's invitations
events.summary: Organizers of the Munich Security Conference have reversed a decision to invite Iranian leadership figures after deadly crackdowns. Officials said the conditions for meaningful dialogue were "no longer in place."

events.title: Livestream: The European Film Awards 2026
events.summary: Who will win at the 2026 European Film Awards? You can watch the show live here on January 17, at 6 p.m. "Sirat" leads with the most nominations.

events.title: Fact check: Woman burning Khamenei photo not in Iran
events.summary: A viral video shows a woman lighting her cigarette from a burning photo of Iran's leader. Many claim it was filmed secretly in Tehran. The image is real; however, it's not from Iran.

events.title: Uganda election: Museveni takes early lead
events.summary: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni holds a strong lead in early results, while his challenger Bobi Wine says security forces have effectively confined him to his home.

events.title: Can South Korea turn the page with Yoon Suk Yeol in prison?
events.summary: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol has been sentenced to five years in the first criminal case linked to his shock declaration of martial law. Many Koreans seem eager to put the crisis behind them.

events.title: Torture, false arrests: Ukrainian women in Russian prisons
events.summary: Some 20,000 Ukrainian civilians are in Russian prisons and rights activists say more than 2,000 are female. Some of the women who have managed to get out jail are now speaking out about what they experienced there.

events.title: Ukraine updates: UK's deputy prime minister arrives in Kyiv
events.summary: Britain's Deputy Prime Minister, David Lammy, has arrived in Ukraine for a Centennial Partnership Forum to discuss future cooperation. Meanwhile, the energy situation in the war-torn country remains dire. DW has more.

events.title: India: Security, terrorism laws used to silence dissent
events.summary: Under India's controversial anti-terror law, UAPA, a suspect can spend years in jail without trial if the accusations against them seem true. Meanwhile Indian courts are also expanding the definition of terrorism.

events.title: What the EU-Mercosur deal might mean for the environment
events.summary: The EU is set to sign a long-awaited trade deal with South America's trade bloc, Mercosur. It may offer unexplored opportunities, but critics say the environmental fallout is being sidelined.

events.title: Greenland: Trump signals tariffs on nations that oppose plan
events.summary: Donald Trump said he may put a tariff on countries that 'don't go along with Greenland,' as he reiterated his demand for US control of the Danish territory. DW has the latest.

events.title: Germany's farms are failing despite high food prices
events.summary: As Berlin's Green Week, the largest international agriculture fair, kicks off, German farmers raise the alarm over price pressure from retailers and international trade agreements like the impending EU-Mercosur deal.

events.title: Serbia student protests: Vucic has reason to fear elections
events.summary: After more than a year of protests, Serbia's students have shifted their focus to preparing for a parliamentary election. President Aleksander Vucic, however, is waiting for a date that will benefit him the most.

events.title: US downplays European troops in Greenland
events.summary: Several European countries have dispatched soldiers to Greenland in a show of support for Denmark. But the US said the move won't change President Trump's intention to acquire the island.

events.title: Germany news: Trial to open over deadly Munich car attack
events.summary: A Munich court is set to open the trial over a car attack on a trade union rally that killed a woman and her child. Meanwhile, Germany says inflation has stabilized, easing from post-pandemic highs. DW has the latest.

events.title: What's driving the changing face of Arctic geopolitics?
events.summary: Donald Trump has renewed global focus on Greenland and the Arctic. Who controls this polar region, and why are power, security and resources at stake?

events.title: How European cinema is stealing Hollywood's spotlight
events.summary: As Hollywood doubles down on sequels, the contenders for the European Film Awards feature bold, political works that are challenging audiences and creating buzz far beyond the continent.

events.title: Livestream: 4 award-winning filmmakers discuss risk-taking cinema
events.summary: DW co-hosts a talk with European Film Award and Oscar nominees Jafar Panahi, Oliver Laxe, Mascha Schilinski and Joachim Trier. Watch it live here.

events.title: NBA Europe to 'respect' European basketball tradition
events.summary: The NBA is pressing ahead with plans to launch a basketball league in Europe, with a slated launch date of 2027.

events.title: Does Moldovan President Maia Sandu really want unification with Romania?
events.summary: Moldova's president Maia Sandu recently stated in a podcast that she would vote in favor of her country joining Romania in the event of a referendum. Her comments have caused outrage.

events.title: Blankets, batteries, fires: How Kyiv is surviving an icy winter as Russia attacks its energy grid
events.summary: Russia has deliberately attacked Ukraine's energy grid, as sub-zero temperatures take hold. Many are without power, heating or water so locals in Kyiv have been sharing their solutions for staying warm.

events.title: Germany: The harsh reality of cutting development aid
events.summary: Germany is cutting its development aid budget. But since development policy is also part of national security, alongside diplomacy and defense, these budget cuts may cause problems.

events.title: Ukraine: Zelenskyy declares energy emergency in cold snap
events.summary: Ukraine's president declared an emergency in the energy sector amid freezing weather and Russian strikes on infrastructure. Meanwhile, Donald Trump blamed Kyiv for the lack of peace talk progress.

events.title: 'Charlie Hebdo' cartoon on Swiss fire tragedy sparks outrage
events.summary: A cartoon by the French satirical weekly portraying the deadly fire in Crans-Montana as the "comedy of the year" provokes disgust.

events.title: German military personnel set to arrive in Greenland
events.summary: Germany said that the European mission in Greenland was there to counter "threats" from Russia and China. The German team is among the groups of European military personnel who are scheduled to arrive in Greenland.

events.title: Women poised to take India sports to the next level
events.summary: India has been experiencing major growth in women's sports in recent years. This is being fuelled by investment from both the public and private sector – as well as many role models.

events.title: Germany news: Economy narrowly avoids 3rd year of recession
events.summary: Germany's GDP grew 0.2% in 2025, ending a run of two consecutive years of recession, new figures show. The justice minister wants to combat the misuse of AI to create sexualized images.

events.title: 'Fundamental disagreement' with US over Greenland remains
events.summary: Danish and Greenlandic officials said they still have a “fundamental disagreement” with President Donald Trump over Greenland after meeting in Washington with Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio.

events.title: Ukraine's new defense minister Fedorov eyes army tech reform
events.summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy aims to boost Ukraine's defense capabilities through technology by appointing Mykhailo Fedorov as the new defense minister.

events.title: Germany: Bundestag president pushes changes to security
events.summary: Drones, spies and extremists? Bundestag President Julia Klöckner sounds the alarm on security gaps threatening Germany’s democracy. Her proposals could hit the far-right AfD party the hardest.

events.title: Rescue or crime? Humanitarian aid workers on trial in Greece
events.summary: Humanitarian aid workers face up to 20 years in prison if found guilty of facilitating the illegal entry of migrants to Greece. The trial has been dubbed "the largest case of the criminalization of solidarity in Europe."

events.title: Wikipedia at 25: Of collective knowledge and its fault lines
events.summary: From utopian origins to AI-driven rivals, the "people's encyclopedia" has been shaped by debates over neutrality, expertise and the future of shared knowledge.

events.title: Louvre hikes ticket price for non-EU visitors by almost half
events.summary: The Louvre museum and several other French cultural sites are increasing the price of entry for visitors from outside Europe. So-called "dual pricing" is quite common in less wealthy countries but rare in richer regions.

events.title: International Space Station crew to make emergency return to Earth
events.summary: A medical emergency will force four astronauts aboard the International Space Station to return to Earth prematurely.

events.title: From the Monroe Doctrine to the Donroe Doctrine
events.summary: America for Americans: That was James Monroe's message to European colonial powers in 1823, to respect the independence of new nations of the Americas. Trump is reinterpreting this doctrine.

events.title: Ukraine: Anti-corruption agencies target former PM
events.summary: Ukraine's anti-corruption agency said it notified a party leader of its suspicion of offering bribes to politicians. It did not name them, but the blurred images it published clearly showed former PM Yulia Tymoshenko.

events.title: Germany: Unjustly jailed man gets €1.3 million compensation
events.summary: The Bavarian state is to give over €1 million to a man who spent 13 years in jail on murder charges that were overturned. Prosecutors had previously called for him to pay for board and lodgings in jail after his release.

events.title: Germany: Gelsenkirchen bank thieves used 'manipulated' door
events.summary: Police say a manipulated emergency exit, that shouldn't open from the outside, gave thieves access in last month's major bank heist in Gelsenkirchen. They warned customers that investigations would likely take months.

events.title: Turkish Cypriots: The EU's invisible Europeans
events.summary: The unresolved Cyprus problem leaves Turkish Cypriots in a state of limbo within the European Union, without full EU rights, recognition or political certainty and economically and diplomatically isolated.

events.title: Germany news: 2 men charged with planning attacks for Russia
events.summary: Two Ukrainians have been accused of planning sabotage attacks for Russian spy services. Meanwhile, Germany's foreign minister has played down the US threat to Greenland.

events.title: Kazakhstan oil output plunges as Ukraine's drones hit Russia
events.summary: Kyiv's attacks on Russian oil terminals and refineries may damage their enemy, but they are also having an impact on other economies such as Kazakhstan's and risk alienating allies.

events.title: 'We choose Denmark' over the US, Greenland’s PM says
events.summary: Greenlandic Prime Minister Jens-Frederik Nielsen said the Arctic territory was facing a "geopolitical crisis" as Trump threatens to take it over. Denmark's Mette Frederiksen condemned "unacceptable pressure" from the US.

events.title: Will Trump risk a clash with China over Iran tariff?
events.summary: Donald Trump's sudden 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran puts Beijing squarely in the spotlight. China knows how to evade sanctions and has the muscle to retaliate. DW explores what this showdown could mean.

events.title: Australians are changing their response to wildfires
events.summary: DW's Stuart Braun had a dangerously near miss during Australia's 2009 "Black Saturday" inferno. As this month's fires burned near his rural home, he wasn't taking any chances.

events.title: Australia: Writers' festival called off amid boycott
events.summary: The Adelaide Writers' Week retracted an invitation to an Australian-Palestinian author, citing the the Bondi Beach attack. Dozens, including the event's director and the former PM of New Zealand, withdrew in response.

events.title: German Chancellor Merz visits India's tech hub Bengaluru
events.summary: Merz is due in Bengaluru, often called India's Silicon Valley, after meeting PM Modi in Ahmedabad. The visit comes just weeks ahead of plans to sign a long-awaited free trade agreement between India and the EU.

events.title: Trump's feud with US Fed chair Powell rattles investors
events.summary: Trump's fight with Federal Reserve Chair Powell just took a new twist — sending stocks and the dollar lower and lifting gold. DW looks into whether a new criminal investigation could put the Fed's independence at risk.

events.title: NATO talks Arctic security for Greenland amid US pressure
events.summary: NATO is signaling it will take steps to bolster Arctic security as the Trump administration has claimed that threats from Russia and China are among the reasons that the US government seeks to take over Greenland.

events.title: Cannabis: Now you can measure how much is too much
events.summary: At what point does smoking weed get dangerous? A British study measured cannabis consumption in THC units and determined which amounts increase health risks. The system comes with clear risk thresholds ― and weaknesses.

events.title: Croatia reintroduces conscription after almost two decades
events.summary: Croatia is bringing back compulsory military service for young men for the first time since 2008. What’s behind the shift — and could it signal a wider return of conscription in the Balkans?

events.title: AI concerns and slow growth put brakes on EU job market
events.summary: The pandemic gave workers increased options as home offices became the norm in some fields. Now, with the EU experiencing industrial slowdown and AI automation, workers are growing increasingly wary of switching jobs.

events.title: Cheating scandal hits Winter Olympics skeleton qualifier
events.summary: An international sports governing body is investigating after a Canadian coach was accused of manipulating an event — depriving racers of qualifying points ahead of February's Winter Olympics.

events.title: Why Venus Williams and other sports stars are playing longer
events.summary: More than three decades after she burst onto the tennis scene, Venus Williams is still playing at the top level. Why are we seeing elite athletes carrying on into their 40s and beyond?

events.title: Germany news: Ice warnings force closure of schools
events.summary: Schools in many parts of Germany have closed their doors following warnings of extremely icy conditions. Meanwhile, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz has started his first state visit to India.

events.title: Menopause: When hormones harm the economy
events.summary: There are 9 million women of menopausal age in Germany's labor force. The change of life can have consequences for an economy. There are things that companies can do to retain their workers.

events.title: 2026 World Cup: Germany to be based at North Carolina hotel
events.summary: Germany will be making a hotel in Winston-Salem their base camp during next summer's World Cup. The choice of headquarters has been seen as key to the national team's success — or failure — at previous World Cups.

events.title: From Guatemala to Panama: US affairs in Latin America
events.summary: The US attack on Venezuela is part of a long history of military interventions and political influence by the United States in Latin America. Here are five such examples since World War II.

events.title: Jack London felt 'Call of the Wild,' lived life of adventure
events.summary: The Klondike gold rush, wolves in the Alaskan snow, adventures on the high seas: Jack London, author of "The Call of the Wild" and "The Sea Wolf," was born 150 years ago. DW looks at his life.

events.title: As China sales slow, Germany's carmakers look to India
events.summary: For decades, German cars symbolized engineering perfection and economic power. Now, sales are down as China, a key market, goes electric. India could fill some of that gap for German carmakers. But will it be enough?

events.title: Germany news: Dobrindt vows to fight left-wing extremism
events.summary: The interior minister says he will "hit back" at left-wing extremists suspected of having caused the Berlin blackout.

events.title: Why Germany, India face obstacles to closer strategic ties
events.summary: In the face of US tariffs, Russian threats and China's ambitions, Germany is courting the Asian giant as a trading and geopolitical partner. But it's not so easy.

events.title: German health minister rejects Robert Kennedy's COVID claims
events.summary: US Health Secretary Robert F Kennedy Jr has claimed that doctors in Germany who issued COVID-19 vaccine exemptions are facing legal action. Health Minister Nina Warken has hit back vehemently at the accusations.

events.title: Venezuela, Greenland, Ukraine: Germany's Merz in crisis mode
events.summary: With foreign policy turbulence, a blackout in Berlin and a high-profile personnel rejig in the Chancellery, 2026 is off to a stormy start for Friedrich Merz.

events.title: Berlin blackouts cast light on infrastructure in Germany
events.summary: An attack that knocked out power in a Berlin suburb raises concern about German infrastructure and disaster readiness. What can and should the country be doing?

events.title: Donald Trump's Venezuela attack stuns Europe's far right
events.summary: Right-wing Trump supporters in Central and Southeastern Europe have operated in a legal gray area for years. After the US's attack on Venezuela, there's a growing awareness that Trump could pose a threat to them, too.

events.title: US balks as UK, France pledge troops to postwar Ukraine
events.summary: Even as France and the UK offer a written commitment to Ukraine to deploy troops in the event of a peace deal, doubts remain whether the US will back those troops in case they come under a Russian attack.

events.title: US troops in Germany are legacy of World War II, Cold War
events.summary: Donald Trump's desire to acquire Greenland has raised questions about the US's commitment to NATO. The US maintains a major military presence in Germany — a vital part of its post-World War II national defense strategy.

events.title: Greenland minister rejects US overtures to buy the territory
events.summary: As the United States increases its overtures and threats, Greenland's mining minister told DW that the territory needs to be treated as a partner, and said the people would decide the fate of their island's resources.

events.title: Czechia ruling coalition divided on support for Ukraine
events.summary: Czechia's new coalition government is sending out conflicting messages on Ukraine — ranging from anti-Kyiv tirades to halfhearted support. What's going on?

events.title: Epiphany blackface in Spain highlights racism in Europe
events.summary: People in Spain called attention to racism after a public official wore blackface at an Epiphany celebration. Countries such as the Netherlands have begun moving away from blackface traditions after efforts by activists.

events.title: Germany: Trust in the United States is eroding
events.summary: In the monthly ARD Deutschlandtrend poll, Germans polled expressed little confidence that 2026 will be a peaceful and prosperous year. The reputation of the US is at an all-time low.

events.title: Greenland: Vance warns Europe to take Trump 'seriously'
events.summary: Europe should take Donald Trump "seriously" on the issue of Greenland, warned US Vice President JD Vance, as Trump's advisers met with envoys from Denmark and Greenland.

events.title: Why Germany struggles to fight financial crime
events.summary: Germany lacks thousands of state prosecutors to effectively fight organized crime, the German Association of Judges has warned. But others say the judicial system's problems run much deeper than that.

events.title: The impact of US withdrawal from global climate pacts
events.summary: The US has pledged to pull out of dozens of international organizations and treaties established to advance the protection of the planet. But it doesn't spell the end of environmental action.

events.title: What to watch out for as the Bundesliga resumes play
events.summary: Bayern Munich seem to have another Bundesliga title all but sealed. But could a serious challenger still emerge? And who is in danger of relegation? DW has you covered.

events.title: Mercosur deal: French farmers roll tractors into Paris
events.summary: Scores of tractors were driven into Paris in protest over an EU deal that would create the world's largest free-trade area. Some farmers fear they will be undercut with cheaper goods from South America.

events.title: Berlin mayor criticized for playing tennis during blackout
events.summary: Mayor Kai Wegner is facing pressure over taking a tennis break during the first hours of what turned out to be the longest blackout in the German capital's postwar history.

events.title: Germany news: Snow warnings for Hamburg, 'Elli' storm nears
events.summary: German forecasters are warning of disruptive snow and ice in the north, and across most of the country overnight. Meanwhile, Berlin Mayor Kai Wegner is facing criticism for playing tennis amid power outage. DW has more.

events.title: China squeezes Japan on dual-use exports amid Taiwan spat
events.summary: Japan called new Chinese restrictions on dual-use exports for its military "absolutely unacceptable," while Beijing followed up with additional limits on dichlorosilane, a chemical used to make semiconductors.

events.title: Germany's local governments face financial collapse
events.summary: Many cities and municipalities in Germany are near bankruptcy, and no longer know how they're supposed to fulfill their responsibilities. They are blaming the federal government.

events.title: Ski jumping: 'Are they trying to pull a fast one on us?'
events.summary: Domen Prevc has followed in his brother's footsteps by winning the Four Hills Tournament. However, more than the Slovenian's achievement, this year's edition may be remembered for less pleasant reasons.

events.title: Venezuela: Trump's $3 billion oil windfall — why it matters
events.summary: US President Donald Trump has announced an agreement with Venezuela's interim government to transfer millions of barrels of oil to the US. DW explores how the plan could be a blow to China, Russia, Iran and Cuba.

events.title: Germany news: Power back in Berlin after arson attack
events.summary: Berlin officials say power has been restored in the southwest of the city after an act of "sabotage" caused a major blackout. Federal prosecutors are investigating a left-wing extremist group. DW has more.

events.title: How clean energy could save us trillions
events.summary: As clean energy prices fall, a fast transition to renewable energy is the cheapest option on the table. Experts say it could save us trillions in energy costs alone.

events.title: T20 World Cup cricket: Why Bangladesh won't travel to India
events.summary: A month before the tournament begins, Bangladesh have said they will not play T20 World Cup matches in India. The decision comes on the back of political and sporting tensions between the countries.

events.title: Can Germany escape its economic slump in 2026?
events.summary: The German economy desperately needs a boost in 2026 after years of downturn. Yet despite massive government spending pledges, optimism is fading among economists.

events.title: Can developing countries leapfrog fossil fuels?
events.summary: Rich nations built their wealth on coal, oil and gas. Now the world is asking poorer countries like Mozambique to chart a different course.

events.title: Ghanaian artist Ibrahim Mahama at top of the art world
events.summary: Best known for large-scale burlap sack installations, Ibrahim Mahama is helping shift power in the art world to the Global South while redefining art as a collective practice.

events.title: What's next for Venezuela oil after US ousts Maduro?
events.summary: US President Donald Trump says now that Nicolas Maduro is gone, more US oil companies will enter Venezuela and spend billions revitalizing its oil industry. Several key questions have to be answered.

events.title: Accordion renews image as Germany's top instrument for 2026
events.summary: The accordion is gaining worldwide popularity. Germany has declared it the instrument of the year for 2026. This versatile music maker is used across various genres, from tango to heavy metal.

events.title: Why plastic bans aren't working and what needs to change
events.summary: Four years after Germany phased out light plastic bags, how has the EU addressed plastic waste? And why do single-use items still pile up in takeaway restaurants, shops and the environment?

events.title: China's BYD overtakes Tesla as world's top EV seller
events.summary: Elon Musk's Tesla has had a tough year and faced intensifying competition from Chinese and European rivals.

events.title: Bulgaria joins eurozone despite opposition
events.summary: Bulgaria became the 21st member of the currency union, bringing the number of people using the single European currency to more than 350 million.

events.title: Anthony Joshua discharged from hospital after Nigeria crash
events.summary: The British heavyweight sustained injuries in a car crash that killed two of his friends.

events.title: What to know about 2026 European Capitals of Culture
events.summary: This year, Oulu, Finland, and Trencin, Slovakia, will become Europe's cultural flagships. Learn more about how Europe's Capitals of Culture program brings lasting change to cities.

events.title: Women get drunk faster than men due to biology not tolerance
events.summary: At the same table, with the same drinks, women often get drunk faster than men — and alcohol can affect women's brains differently, making its effects stronger, sometimes more rewarding. But also more addictive.

events.title: A German tip for your New Year's resolutions
events.summary: Starting off the year with ambitious plans to become a better person is a widespread Western tradition. What are the most popular resolutions in Germany? And here's how the German language can help you deal with yours.

events.title: Six ways the 2026 World Cup will be different
events.summary: The United States is set to host the 2026 World Cup, along with Canada and Mexico. DW fills you in on why this tournament will be different than its predecessors.

events.title: Sudan defying war to bring joy at AFCON 2025
events.summary: A brutal civil war has been raging in Sudan since 2023. The national football team is participating in the Africa Cup of Nations in Morocco with more than just sporting success in mind.

events.title: What challenges does the world economy face in 2026?
events.summary: From trade tensions and high debt burdens to fears of an AI stocks bubble, the global economy will face an array of risks that could dampen growth in the new year.

events.title: Taiwan heavily reliant on Russian energy for chip manufacturing
events.summary: The island imports significant qualities of Russian naphtha, a fossil-fuel derivative needed in the high-tech sector. Until recently, it also sourced much of its coal from Russia.

events.title: New Year's Eve: How to make resolutions for 2026
events.summary: Quit smoking, exercise more, eat healthier: Every January 1, we plan to do great things over the next year — only to fail most of the time. Here's how to make sure your New Year's resolutions work out.

events.title: Bulgaria joining eurozone is big deal
events.summary: The southeastern European country is set to ditch its national currency in favor of the euro. But while Bulgaria's economy has improved, mismanagement and corruption remain rampant.

events.title: Aurora lights: The science behind the dazzling nighttime spectacle
events.summary: The northern and southern lights have been treating sky watchers to spectacular shows. But what causes the colors, and why shouldn't you whistle at the aurora?

events.title: AI chatbots are 'alarmingly' biased against dialect speakers
events.summary: Don't speak perfect Oxford English? You may face "shocking" levels of discrimination when using large language models, researchers have found. New customized AI models could be the answer.

events.title: Climate coverage shrinks amid Trump's clean energy misinformation
events.summary: A strong majority of Americans say they're worried about the climate. So why do they hear so little about it in the news?

events.title: French actress and activist Brigitte Bardot dies aged 91
events.summary: The French screen legend appeared in 56 films before ending her career in 1973 and dedicating herself to animal rights activism.

events.title: German company Miele to sell more refurbished appliances
events.summary: The secondhand smartphone market has grown significantly in recent years, but other, bulkier items like washing machines are less frequently refurbished and resold. That could soon be changing.

events.title: Achraf Hakimi and football's growing issue: playing time
events.summary: According to a new FIFPRO report, Morocco and Paris Saint-Germain star Achraf Hakimi is a footballer at his limit, having had a season that lasted nearly a whole year. After an injury, he is now at AFCON with Morocco.

events.title: Germany at the 2026 World Cup: What next?
events.summary: Now that they have qualified and drawn in group E, Germany head into the final part of their 2026 World Cup preparations. Here's what to know.

events.title: Why Germany struggles to go digital
events.summary: Germany still leans on fax machines and paperwork for basic public services. How can a nation of tech pioneers be so slow to adopt digital government?

events.title: Peak oil: Why the world can't break its fossil fuel habit
events.summary: Climate change shifted the oil production debate from scarcity to demand. If countries do not deliver on ambitious green pledges, one expert predicts that production may peak within two years, forcing a chaotic decline.

events.title: Berlin: Archaeological finds illuminate the city's medieval past
events.summary: A brand-new museum showcases the many fascinating medieval artefacts that archaeologists are finding underneath the German capital.

events.title: Munich surfers abandon attempt to restart Eisbach wave
events.summary: City authorities are putting up unnecessary resistance to restoring the world-famous surf spot, the local sports association said.

events.title: Football: Afghan women make statement on international stage
events.summary: Afghanistan's female footballers have been fighting in exile to get back to playing internationally for years. Earlier this year, their moment arrived, but their mission is far from complete.

events.title: Can dogs really sense danger?
events.summary: Research shows what canines really can sense — and how social media and human projection fuel belief in their supernatural abilities.

events.title: The Christmas truce of 1914: When the guns fell silent
events.summary: On Christmas Eve 1914, battling German and British soldiers laid down their arms and sang Christmas carols together — a brief moment of peace in the midst of war.

events.title: 7 mysterious languages that have yet to be deciphered
events.summary: Indus, Rongorongo, Linear A: Some ancient writing systems cannot be deciphered. Can artificial intelligence help crack the codes of the past?

events.title: How Germany's Deutsche Bahn aims to fix chronic delays
events.summary: German trains used to run like clockwork. Today, delays are the rule, not the exception. As public anger is boiling over, what went wrong with a system once envied worldwide, and why are the Swiss getting it right?

events.title: Ryanair faces massive fine in Italy over 'abusive strategy'
events.summary: Italy's competition authority AGCM claims the budget airline blocked payment methods and mass-deleted accounts to manipulate travel agencies and force them into partnerships. Ryanair has pledged to appeal the fine.

events.title: North Korea's Kim Jong Un, daughter open luxury resort
events.summary: Five new hotels were opened in Samjiyon, near the Chinese border, with Kim Jong Un praising the "rising status" of North Korea's people.

events.title: This is how Christmas is celebrated at the Vatican
events.summary: This year, Pope Leo XIV will lead the Christmas celebrations at the Vatican for the first time. But the popular Christmas traditions at the heart of the Roman Catholic Church remain unchanged.

events.title: Why Trump backs Bayer in Roundup weedkiller cancer battle
events.summary: The Trump administration has diverged from the position of former US President Joe Biden, throwing its weight behind German chemical giant Bayer in its courtroom battle over the pesticide Roundup.

events.title: AFCON: A 3,000-kilometer bike ride to catch the opener
events.summary: The Africa Cup of Nations is drawing thousands of fans to Morocco, and one chose an unusual way to get there. Moroccan fan Ismail Skira cycled thousands of kilometers from Paris for the opening match.

events.title: Christmas in the air: Why scents spark emotions and memories
events.summary: The scent of fresh pine and apple cider makes you think of the holidays at grandma's house? You're not alone. Smells are our strongest sensory trigger for memories — both happy and painful.

events.title: Not just hocus pocus: when words were used to treat the sick
events.summary: Incantations were not only meant to ward off demons, but also to calm patients. A look into medical history reveals what lies behind the idea of tooth worms and the power of utterances like "hocus pocus."

events.title: 3I/ATLAS: Interstellar comet comes closest to Earth
events.summary: Sometimes "the universe comes to us," writes the European Space Agency. On Friday it came really close, when comet 3l/ATLAS passed by us at a ― relatively ― short distance. What exactly is this interstellar visitor?

events.title: German business bankruptcies hit decade high amid downturn
events.summary: Business bankruptcies have climbed to an 11-year high, with small firms hardest hit by Germany's anemic growth. Economists warn of job losses but see tentative signs that the insolvency wave may be leveling off.

events.title: Five things to know about AFCON
events.summary: Excellent infrastructure, ambitious teams, young stars and veterans who are far from finished — the 35th edition of AFCON promises plenty.

events.title: Can Santa Claus survive in a melting world?
events.summary: As climate change warms the planet, snowy winters are becoming less certain in Europe. Those looking for classic Christmas traditions are learning to adapt.

events.title: Plane owned by ex-NASCAR driver Greg Biffle crashes in US
events.summary: A small aircraft owned by Greg Biffle crashed and exploded while attempting to land at Statesville Regional Airport in North Carolina. Seven people died in the crash, including the 56-year-old retired NASCAR driver.

events.title: Bayern Munich buy ex-Bundesliga stadium for women's team
events.summary: Bayern Munich are set to purchase a larger stadium for their women's team. The club's CEO described the move as "another milestone" for Bayern's women's program.

events.title: Women's health suffers, bearing the brunt of household labor
events.summary: Even as economic roles shift in romantic partnerships, women still shoulder most of the labor at home. Research suggests this is a burden affecting women's health, leading to emotional fatigue and depression.

events.title: Euro 2029 in Germany about more than profit margins
events.summary: Hosting Euro 2029 is a chance for women's football in Germany to leave a legacy beyond profit and prove investment in women is smart move.

events.title: Cheaper, cleaner energy drives Germany's balcony-solar boom
events.summary: The home-fitted renewable-energy sources are inexpensive and easy to install, and reduce electricity costs. Here's what can be learned from their surging popularity in Germany.

events.title: ‘Soft-power diplomacy’: Denmark hosts US delegation amid Trump's Arctic threats
events.summary: Denmark’s leaders are trying their hand at “soft-power diplomacy” as they host a US delegation in Copenhagen, Danish journalist Trine Villemann told FRANCE 24. Eleven US lawmakers are visiting the city on Friday to express support for Denmark and Greenland, emphasising that President Donald Trump’s designs on the Arctic island do not have the backing of the American people.

events.title: Russia: successive snowstorms engulf far eastern region of Kamchatka
events.summary:
Heavy snow is not uncommon in Kamchatka, but the unusual intensity of the storms has left the region's major city partially paralysed. Snow piles reached three metres high, and sometimes even more. Schools have shut and businesses have switched to remote working.
 
#snow #russia #storm

events.title: US-Europe standoff on Greenland 'a big win for Putin': Danish parliament defence chair
events.summary: For US President Donald Trump, mocking a country or a leader is not just a reality TV-style soundbite, it is an early warning sign of military action. Trump scorned Nicolas Maduro for "playing tough" before snatching the Venezuelan leader. Now he contemptuously talks of Denmark "adding two more dogsleds" to defend Greenland. European countries do appear to be taking this latest threat seriously, but can they actually stop Trump from taking over Greenland? And how do they navigate this crisis when they must also stay focused on Ukraine? We put these questions to Rasmus Jarlov, chair of the defence committee in the Danish parliament.

events.title: Arrests reported by official media for first time since Tehran protests began
events.summary: Friday marks the fifth day since the last demonstrations in Tehran, FRANCE 24 correspondent Siavosh Ghazi reported from the Iranian capital. He said the news agency Tasnim, which is linked to the Revolutionary Guards, has reported arrests of protesters for the first time since the mass demonstrations began. No death toll or figures for the injured were provided, Ghazi added.

events.title: Greenland’s security and defence cooperation with NATO allies 'achievable within existing framework'
events.summary: Mark Owen is pleased to welcome Sophie Arts, Programme Officer at the German Marshall Fund's Geostrategy North team. In a time of heightened geopolitical crises across the globe, Greenland has emerged as a symbol of a new post WWII order and an alliance facing an existential threat. Ms. Arts speaks of a dynamic power landscape best addressed through dialogue, transparency, and multilateral frameworks. Ms. Arts asserts that NATO's 76-year-old alliance has an "opportunity to transform that challenging rhetoric into a stronger and more unified NATO."

events.title: EU-Mercosur trade pact agreed: Is it the end for opponents of the deal?
events.summary: A majority of EU member states have voted in favour of a landmark free trade deal with Latin American countries. The Mercosur agreement has been 25 years in the making, and its supporters are adamant that it will assert Europe's geostrategic position and benefit consumers. But despite the green light from the EU Council, Mercosur continues to face opposition from countries such as France, as well as from many farmers in the EU. Meanwhile, the European Parliament still has to have its final say. We discuss the deal with two MEPs.

events.title: Trump threatens tariffs on countries not backing US takeover of Greenland
events.summary: President Donald Trump said for the first time on Friday that he might use tariffs to punish countries that "don't go along with" his plans for the US to acquire Greenland. European leaders have repeatedly said that the US cannot seize control of the island, which is a semi-autonomous territory of Denmark.

events.title: Predators under threat: Brazil's jaguars find shelter in nature reserve
events.summary: In Brazil, where cattle ranching is a major industry, jaguars are seen as a threat and are hunted to prevent attacks on livestock. Along with habitat loss, the illegal killing of jaguars has pushed the species to the brink of extinction. According to the World Wild Fund (WWF), there are only about 173,000 jaguars left in the wild. But one Brazilian nature reserve is giving these big cats a place to recover and thrive. Our France 2 colleagues report.

events.title: US lawmakers seek to reassure Greenland in visit to Denmark
events.summary: A bipartisan US Congress delegation began a visit to Copenhagen on Friday to voice support for Denmark and Greenland after US President Donald Trump threatened to take over the Arctic island, an autonomous Danish territory. The two-day visit comes alongside a European show of support in the form of a military reconnaissance mission to Greenland. FRANCE 24's Kethevane Gorjestani brings you this analysis.

events.title: Iranian women on the frontline of protests
events.summary: This week, we focus on Iran as the country has been rocked by its largest wave of protests since the Islamic revolution in 1979. Human rights groups outside Iran report that thousands have been killed so far. Yet amid the turmoil, women activists and youth campaigners are at the forefront of the struggle, seeking to chart a new course for the nation after decades of repressive rule under the Islamic Republic. Annette Young talks to Iranian filmmaker, Sepideh Farsi and Tara Kangarlou, an Iranian-American journalist, as they watch their home country, from afar, undergo a seismic transformation.

events.title: New seasons, new obsessions: January's must-watch TV series
events.summary: A new year, new seasons and no shortage of must-see television: January's TV series show on arts24 dives into the biggest returns and boldest new chapters on the small screen, guided by arts24 TV critic Dheepthika Laurent and presented by Eve Jackson. We kick off in Paris with the world premiere of "Bridgerton" season four. This new chapter centres on Benedict Bridgerton, the family's free-spirited second son, played by Luke Thompson, whose Cinderella-inspired romance with Sophie – portrayed by Australian actress Yerin Ha – opens up the "downstairs" world for the first time.

events.title: One year of Trump in the White House: America more divided than ever
events.summary: In the space of one year, US President Donald Trump has signed hundreds of executive orders. He has ordered mass deportations, cut thousands of federal jobs, launched a trade war and withdrawn the US from major international institutions and agreements. How has his first year back in power been perceived at home? Are his Republican Party and his MAGA base still fully behind him? Our correspondent Matthieu Mabin reports.

events.title: Iran - FRANCE 24 exclusive: 'Erfan is just a protester, he can't be imprisoned for this'
events.summary:
It was feared 26-year-old protester Erfan Soltani would be sentenced to death, a first since the start of the protests in Iran. But on January 15, Iranian authorities said that, if convicted, he would not be given a death sentence. FRANCE 24's spoke to one of Erfan's relatives, who calls for his liberation.
 
 
 
#iran #iranprotests #erfansoltani

events.title: Trump's world: India and EU draw closer
events.summary: In this week's edition of Access Asia, we explore how India and the EU are edging closer, as reports swirl that the two sides are in the final stages of securing a free trade deal. This shift in the relationship comes as both powers grapple with an unpredictable Donald Trump. Plus, we find out how K-pop is thriving abroad but facing a slump at home, as "KPop Demon Hunters" goes home with two Golden Globes.

events.title: Behind the media coverage of Iran's brutal crackdown
events.summary: Iran's nationwide protest movement appears to have slowed amid a brutal crackdown by authorities that has killed thousands of people and put tens of thousands more in prison. This week FRANCE 24's media show Scoop looks at international media coverage and the competing narratives. Our guest is award-winning journalist Samira Mohyeddin.

events.title: Ukrainians brave winter cold as Russia targets energy infrastructure
events.summary: Hundreds of thousands of Ukrainian homes are either entirely without heating, or with severely reduced heating. This, as temperatures rarely rise above minus 10. It’s the result of Russia’s campaign of drone and missile attacks on the country’s energy facilities, which Volodymyr Zelensky says Moscow has deliberately intensified to coincide with the cold weather. FRANCE 24's Gulliver Cragg reports.

events.title: Civilians flee Kurdish-held region in northern Syria ahead of army deadline
events.summary: Civilians fled a Kurdish-held region of northern Syria on Friday before a deadline set by the army, which seeks to expand its control over the area after driving Kurdish forces from Aleppo. The government is seeking to extend its authority nationwide following the ousting of longtime leader Bashar al-Assad in December 2024.

events.title: Venezuela's opposition leader Machado presents Trump with her Nobel Peace Prize
events.summary:
Less than two weeks after the US operation that led to Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's capture, the country's opposition leader Maria Corina Machado presented Donald Trump with her Nobel Peace Prize. The move comes as the US president has repeatedly said he does not think she is fit to lead Venezuela.
 
#venezuela #trump #nobel

events.title: US claims Iran halts executions of protesters amid crackdown on dissent
events.summary: The United States on Thursday said Iran halted 800 executions of protesters under pressure from President Donald Trump, after Gulf allies appeared to pull him back from military action over Tehran's deadly crackdown on demonstrations. Iran was shaken over the last week by some of the biggest anti-government protests in the history of the Islamic republic, although the demonstrations appear to have diminished over the last few days in the face of repression and a week-long internet blackout.

events.title: ‘I saw 12 people collapsed in a pool of blood’: Eyewitness describes Iran’s deadly crackdown
events.summary: A Tehran resident who took part in the protests that have roiled Iran before fleeing the country has described a deadly crackdown – with security forces firing indiscriminately at protesters with machine guns and assault rifles – in an exclusive interview with FRANCE 24.

events.title: Residents of Tunisian town of Gabes demand end to pollution
events.summary: In the southern Tunisian town of Gabes, anger has been simmering in recent months as locals demand the dismantlement of the Tunisian Chemical Group. This state-owned enterprise turns phosphate into fertiliser, often emitting toxic gases. So far, however, protesters have not achieved their goals. Our correspondents report.

events.title: A cultural stroll through Paris with singer Pascal Obispo and actress Julie Depardieu
events.summary: This week, Valérie Fayolle meets Pascal Obispo. His melodies have left their mark on the French musical landscape and he's well known as an author, composer and performer. Now we meet his alter-ego, the painter! Pascal takes us to the Ange Basso gallery in Paris's 6th arrondissement, where his artwork is on currently on show. We also discover Julie Depardieu's one-woman show, "La Misérable" at the Marigny studio. Depardieu plays Juliette Drouet, the woman who was Victor Hugo's mistress for almost 50 years.

events.title: Drones and influence: Exclusive investigation into Turkey's power play in Africa
events.summary: Over the past two decades, Turkey has become a major player in Africa. Although more discreet than China or Russia, Ankara has managed to successfully expand its influence on the continent. From drones to scholarship programmes, from construction deals to Islamic humanitarian NGOs, FRANCE 24's Karina Chabour reports on how Turkey is reshuffling the balance of power in Africa.

events.title: Venezuela's opposition leader Machado presents Trump with her Nobel Peace Prize
events.summary:
Less than two weeks after the US operation that led to Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro's capture, the country's opposition leader Maria Corina Machado presented Donald Trump with her Nobel Peace Prize. The move comes as the US president has repeatedly said he does not think she is fit to lead Venezuela.
 
#venezuela #trump #nobel

events.title: 'Massacre' as Uganda election descends into deadly violence
events.summary: At least seven people have been killed as Uganda's presidential election was engulfed by violence.

events.title: More than 100 people die as torrential rain and flooding hit three countries
events.summary: More than 100 people have been killed after torrential rain caused flooding across South Africa, Mozambique and Zimbabwe, with authorities issuing warnings that more severe weather is expected across several countries in southern Africa.

events.title: Julio Iglesias responds to sex abuse and trafficking allegations
events.summary: Julio Iglesias has denied abusing two former domestic employees behind a criminal complaint against him, calling the accusations "completely false".

events.title: We can learn a lot from Antarctica's weird biology
events.summary: Even though it's high summer in the Antarctic, the ocean around the Rothera research station is -1 Celsius.

events.title: Machado gave Trump her Nobel Peace Prize medal in pursuit of a greater prize
events.summary: The Nobel Peace Prize means a lot to Maria Corina Machado but, clearly, giving it away means even more.

events.title: South Korea's ex-president jailed for five years over martial law declaration
events.summary: The former president of South Korea, Yoon Suk Yeol, has been sentenced to five years in prison on charges relating to his failed martial law declaration.

events.title: How Ugandan government is trying to stop pop star politician
events.summary: Bobi Wine's house is heavily surveilled.

events.title: 'It's like a road closure' - Uganda's president on shutting down the internet as his country votes
events.summary: A church service at Nakasero State House marks the end of a frenetic election cycle.

events.title: International Space Station astronauts back on Earth after first ever emergency return
events.summary: An astronaut who had a "serious medical condition" onboard the International Space Station is safely back on Earth, after the first-ever emergency return space flight.

events.title: Trump given Nobel Peace Prize medal by its Venezuelan winner at White House
events.summary: Donald Trump has been presented with a Nobel Peace Prize medal by Maria Corina Machado, the leader of the Venezuelan opposition, who won the award last year.

events.title: British police force chief behind decision to ban Maccabi fans from Aston Villa match retires
events.summary: A British police force chief has retired following criticism over a decision to ban Maccabi Tel Aviv fans from a match against Aston Villa last year

events.title: Mexican president highlights 'compelling results' in crackdown of cartels in face of Trump threats
events.summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum says that efforts to crack down on Mexican cartels and slow migration north were showing “compelling results” in an effort to head off intervention by the Trump administration

events.title: Trump says he may punish countries with tariffs if they don’t back the US controlling Greenland
events.summary: President Donald Trump says he may punish countries with tariffs if they don’t back the U.S. controlling Greenland

events.title: South Africa investigates Iran's participation in naval drills off its coast after US criticism
events.summary: South Africa has launched an investigation over the participation of Iranian warships in naval drills off its coast

events.title: Cuba honors soldiers killed in Venezuela and other top photos from Latin America and the Caribbean
events.summary:
Jan. 9-15, 2026

The remains of 32 Cuban officers killed during a U.S. strike on Venezuela were repatriated to their homeland. The soldiers were part of the security detail of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro during the Jan. 3 raid on his residence to seize the former leader and bring him to the U.S. to face drug trafficking charges.

Venezuela’s acting President Delcy Rodríguez used her first state of the union message to advocate for opening the crucial state-run oil industry to more foreign investment following the Trump administration’s pledge to seize control of Venezuelan crude sales.

___

This gallery was curated by photojournalist Moises Castillo, based in Guatemala City.

___

events.summary: The UN Security Council is meeting in New York in emergency session on Iran, amid escalating concern over reports that hundreds have been killed during weeks of nationwide anti-government protests. The meeting was requested by the United States. Demonstrations that began in late December, fuelled by soaring inflation, rising food prices and the collapse of the national currency, triggered a deadly and widespread crackdown with thousands injured and detained, according to numerous firsthand accounts. The UN has called for independent investigations into all killings and warned against the possible use of the death penalty against protesters. Follow live coverage below, and UN News app users can go here.

events.summary: The foreign ministers of Denmark and Greenland met Vice President JD Vance and Secretary of State Marco Rubio amid President Donald Trump's push to take control of the Arctic island. NBC News' Garrett Haake reports on the meeting's outcome and the officials' current stance regarding Greenland.

events.title: ‘The sea attacked us’: Winter weather destroys Gazans makeshift homes
events.summary: Strong winds and flooding have made life even more difficult for the hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians living in crowded tent camps with little sanitation. Four infants have died from exposure to the cold.

events.title: What to know about Elon Musk and China with Tesla's massive 'Gigafactory' in Shanghai
events.summary: Billionaire tech executive Elon Musk’s relationship with party leaders in China is in the spotlight as the trade war ramps up. NBC News’ Janis Mackey Frayer reports on what this means for his popularity in the country.

events.title: Iranian celebrities call for action against regime amid protests
events.summary: About 26 years ago, Iran’s biggest female pop star left her homeland to tour internationally after years of being banned from publicly performing by the theocratic regime

events.title: Trump's Gaza peace plan enters second phase
events.summary: The United States will push forward with the next phase of its plan for peace in Gaza, moving toward "demilitarization, technocratic governance, and reconstruction," President Donald Trump's special envoy Steve Witkoff said Wednesday

events.title: Death toll in Hong Kong fire rises to 168 after more remains are identified
events.summary: The death toll from a fire at a residential complex in Hong Kong has risen to 168 from 161, officials said Thursday, after the remains of more victims were identified seven weeks after the Chinese territory’s worst blaze in decades.

events.title: Pentagon to send additional forces to the Middle East as Iran tensions rise
events.summary: Iran signaled it would not move ahead with executing protesters and reopened its airspace Thursday, as President Donald Trump left it unclear whether he would take military action over the regime's deadly crackdown

events.title: Venezuela promised to free political prisoners, but their families are still waiting
events.summary: CARACAS, Venezuela — The joy prompted by news that Venezuela would free an “important number” of prisoners has given way to anguish for many of their loved ones.

events.title: Under Iran's internet blackout, SpaceX's Starlink is a lifeline — if it can stay online
events.summary: The near-total ban on outside communication has left Starlink as the only choice for many in Iran.

events.title: European troops arrive in Greenland as Trump throws another curveball
events.summary: European troops were arriving in Greenland on Thursday in a show of support, as leaders scrambled to respond to President Donald Trump’s threats.

events.title: Trump still intent on 'conquering Greenland,' Denmark says after White House talks
events.summary: Denmark said it did not manage to dissuade President Donald Trump from seeking to conquer Greenland during high-level talks at the White House on Wednesday.

events.title: U.S. evacuating troops from air base in Qatar ahead of possible Iran military action
events.summary: The United States has started evacuating hundreds of troops from its largest air base in the Middle East ahead of potential military action by President Donald Trump against Iran, according to a U.S. official and a person familiar with the matter

events.title: 2025 was the third-hottest year ever recorded on Earth, data shows
events.summary: Last year was the third-warmest in modern history, according to Copernicus, the European Union’s climate monitoring service.

events.title: Multiple Americans detained in Venezuela have been released, State Department says
events.summary: Multiple American citizens who were detained in Venezuela have been released, the State Department said Wednesday.

events.title: China reports record $1.2 trillion trade surplus, defying Trump's tariffs
events.summary: China had its biggest trade surplus ever last year at almost $1.2 trillion, according to data released Wednesday, defying tariffs President Donald Trump has imposed on the world’s second-largest economy as it sends more exports to other parts of the world.

events.title: Iranian death toll reaches 2,000, rights group says, as Trump tells protesters 'help is on the way'
events.summary: President Donald Trump urged Iranian civilians to keep protesting and said “help is on its way” Tuesday amid a crackdown on anti-government demonstrations that a U.S.-based human rights group says has killed 2,500 people

events.title: Trump announces 25% tariff on countries doing business with Iran amid deadly protest crackdown
events.summary: President Donald Trump said Iran wants to negotiate but warned he may still carry out strikes over its violent crackdown on protests challenging the regime's rule.

events.title: Australian teen charged with making hoax mass shooting calls to U.S. institutions
events.summary: An Australian teenager has been charged over multiple hoax calls he is alleged to have made falsely claiming that mass shootings were underway at major U.S. educational institutions and retailers
